articles.title: Quang Nguyen
articles.contents:
Biography



I am a first year PhD student in the Department of Statistics & Data Science at Carnegie Mellon University.
I completed my Master of Science degree in Applied Statistics at Loyola University Chicago in December 2021. More previously, I graduated from Wittenberg University in Springfield, Ohio with a BS in Mathematics and Data Science in May 2020. I am originally from Nha Trang, Khanh Hoa, which is located in the South Central Coast of Vietnam (hence this is what qntkhvn represents). In my free time, you may find me watching sports, listening to podcasts, and cooking. I am a huge supporter of Manchester United F.C. of the English Premier League as well as NBA’s LA Clippers.
Education
  
PhD in Statistics and Data Science, in progress
        Carnegie Mellon University
  
MS in Applied Statistics, December 2021
        Loyola University Chicago
  
BS in Mathematics and Data Science, May 2020
        Wittenberg University
Interests
Data science
Applications of statistics and machine learning in sports
Contact
   nminhquang.99@gmail.com
   @qntkhvn
My old website: qntkhvn.github.io/quang

articles.title: News
articles.contents:
10/2022: Awarded 3rd place of the Reproducible Research Competition (Open Methods Track) at the 2022 Carnegie Mellon Sports Analytics Conferece (CMSAC) with my paper Estimating Aging Curves: Using Multiple Imputation to Examine Career Trajectories of MLB Offensive Players.
09/2022: Invited talk at the 2022 Cascadia Symposium on Statistics in Sports (CASSIS).
08/2022: Started my PhD in the Department of Statistics and Data Science at Carnegie Mellon University.
05/2022: Guest appearance on Episode IX of the Open Source Sports Podcast.
03/2022: Paper An Examination of Olympic Sport Climbing Competition Format and Scoring System was accepted for publication in the Journal of Data Science.
Spring 2022: Worked as an instructor in the Department of Mathematics and Statistics at Loyola University Chicago.
12/2021: Completed my MS in Applied Statistics at Loyola University Chicago.
11/2021: Awarded 1st place of the Reproducible Research Competition (Open Methods Track) at the 2021 Carnegie Mellon Sports Analytics Conferece (CMSAC) with my paper An Examination of Sport Climbing’s Competition Format and Scoring System.
10/2021: Won the Best Student Poster Award at the 2021 UConn Sports Analytics Conferece (UCSAS) with my poster Concerns Regarding Sport Climbing Competition Format and Scoring System: Who’s Suffering?
10/2021: Took part in the 2021 Humana-Mays Healthcare Analytics Case Competition (organized by Texas A&M University). Our team finished 2/50 in the First Round Leaderboard, where the goal was to build a model for predicting vaccine hesitancy.
09/2021: Participated in a live coding session where I tried to predict the 2021 Brownlow Medal Winner for the Australian Football League (AFL). This was Rob Nguyen’s idea, where he wanted to pair up a stats person with no knowledge of Aussie rules with a journalist with domain expertise to see how well they can do at making predictions. Here are links to a video recording and an article on ABC News (Australia).
